docs.lead_paragraph: With no clear path on major health legislation, Democratic leaders in Congress signaled slower going on the president’s top domestic priority.

headline.seo: Democrats Now See ‘No Rush’ on Health Care Bill
headline.main: Democrats Put Lower Priority on Health Bill
headline.print_headline: Democrats in Congress Put Lower Priority on Health Care Bill After G.O.P. Victory

docs.snippet: With no clear path on major health legislation, Democratic leaders in Congress signaled slower going on the president’s top domestic priority.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Though it may be the only way forward for President Obama's domestic priority, it seems increasingly unlikely that House Democrats will be persuaded to pass the Senate health care legislation. The House and Senate bills are alike in many ways, but Speaker Nancy Pelosi has said there were Senate provisions that many House Democrats simply could not swallow, provisions that might fuel voter outrage of the sort so vividly on display in Massachusetts last week.
docs.abstract: House Democrats seem unlikely to pass Senate version of health bill; Speaker Nancy Pelosi says some Senate provisions, like caps on coverage, are unacceptable; House bill eliminates lifetime caps starting in 2010 and eliminates annual caps in 2013; Senate bill eliminates lifetime caps for new plans six months after law's enactment and eliminates some annual caps but with exemptions (M)
docs.snippet: Though it may be the only way forward for President Obama's domestic priority, it  seems increasingly unlikely that House Democrats will be persuaded to pass the Senate health care legislation.     The House and Senate bills are alike in many ways,...

docs.lead_paragraph: An annotated video and transcript of President Obama’s speech.

headline.main: Analyzing the State of the Union Address

docs.snippet: An annotated video and transcript of President Obama’s speech.

docs.lead_paragraph: What will President Obama say about health care? White House officials have offered a preview in recent days of some of the main features of the president's State of the Union speech on Wednesday night, including modest proposals designed to appeal to middle-class families, like added tax credits for child care and caps on some student loan payments, and a call to begin tackling the federal deficit with a freeze on part of the government's discretionary spending.
docs.abstract: White House officials offer preview of portion of Pres Obama's State of the Union speech that includes proposals designed to appeal to middle-class families; they are less forthcoming about what he will say about embattled health care overhaul, which remains Obama's top domestic priority; senior Democrats maintain they do not expect Obama to chart specific course of action but acknowledge that he could surprise them (M)
docs.snippet: What will President Obama say about health care?      White House officials have offered a preview in recent days of some of the main features of the president's State of the Union speech on Wednesday night, including modest proposals designed to...

docs.lead_paragraph: In a sign of how hard it is for Democrats to regroup on major health care legislation, two centrist Democratic senators said on Tuesday that they would oppose efforts to muscle through a bill using a procedural tactic called budget reconciliation.

headline.main: Lincoln and Bayh Vow to Oppose Budget Reconciliation

docs.abstract: Two Democratic Senators come out against budget reconciliation as a way of moving ahead with health care legislation.
docs.snippet: Two Democratic Senators come out against budget reconciliation as a way of moving ahead with health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Though it may be the only way forward for President Obama's top domestic priority, it is not clear that House Democrats can be induced to pass the Senate health care legislation. Though the House and Senate bills are alike in many ways, there are Senate provisions that many House Democrats simply can't swallow, according to the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi - provisions that might fuel voter outrage of the sort so vividly on on display in Massachusetts.
docs.abstract: One difference between the Senate and House health care bills points to the difficulty in producing pared-back legislation.
docs.snippet: One difference between the Senate and House health care bills points to the difficulty in producing pared-back legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: HONOLULU - One of the top items of business for the Republican National Committee, as it gathers amid lagoons and pools at an oceanfront resort in the heart of this city this week, is to pass a so-called "purity" resolution being put forth by some of its more conservative members.

headline.main: After Brown's Win, G.O.P. Officials Weigh 'Purity' Test

docs.abstract: Some Republicans worry that a resolution proposed by conservatives would have crippled their efforts to aid the candidacy of Senator-elect Scott Brown.
docs.snippet: Some Republicans worry that a resolution proposed by conservatives would have crippled their efforts to aid the candidacy of Senator-elect Scott Brown.
